Title: Data analyst
Description:
Company Description

A positive future for all – that’s what we at Sopra Steria work towards. With over 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we are Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. We believe it’s not only technology that powers transformation. It’s people who are at the core of change. That’s why it’s people that are at the heart of everything we do, excelling both independently and in team. The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

You identify their needs and translate them into information solutions. You also draw up validated requirements and specifications with the right quality and depth and prioritize these with the business. You’re the point of contact for the organization and for the scrum teams when it comes to content. And you’re able to clearly convey what needs to be realized like no other.

You have a passion for your work and a focus on customer satisfaction and quality. Guts, proactive communication skills and a strong analytical approach are essential for your role as a Data Analyst.

You bridge the gap between business, information and technology as a one of Sopra Steria’s Data Analysts. Like a true subject matter expert, you hold discussions with stakeholders such as administrators, users and architects. You identify their needs and translate them into information solutions. You also draw up validated requirements and specifications with the right quality and depth and prioritize these with the business. You’re the point of contact for the organization and for the scrum teams when it comes to content. And you’re able to clearly convey what needs to be realized like no other.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

Type of employment: Hybrid

Location: Nieuwegein

Contract hours: 32-40 hour workweek

Contract type: Permanent

Education: you have completed a HBO or WO education in the direction of IT

Languages: Dutch (required) and English

You have knowledge and experience of the following:


Minimum two years’ experience in data analysis and data design
Affinity with data, data structures and data mapping
Knowledge and experience with data modeling and relational algebra
Accurate and precise work ethic
Analytical thinking skills, strong communication skills and a practical attitude
Experience with SQL is a definite advantage


Additional Information

As Europe’s leading digital service provider, Sopra Steria expects our workers to make bold choices and deliver results. We attract high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation. Working for us means driving success for Europe’s most prominent businesses across multiple industries.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A permanent contract and an attractive salary proper to your role
Mobility arrangements: A generous mobility budget that suits your preferred way of traveling. Choice between a car allowance or a company car
A wide range of fringe benefits such as a home office, laptop (choice between a MacBook Pro or Windows), a phone and pension plan
Holidays: 20 legal days which can be extended with 7 days by using Flex Benefits budget. Another 13 days can be bought using salary.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development
A chance to expand and share your ability through knowledge and network sessions, and fun social activities: gaming nights, escape rooms, laser games, and much more


Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

Want to know what happens next?

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is one of the top tier financial institutions in the Netherlands, operating within (health) insurances, mortgages, pension and investments. The company is experiencing interesting years; they are amid of some major acquisitions and their ongoing IT transformation, migrating their environments/applications to the public cloud.




One of the pillars for the transformation is embracing a data driven strategy.

The company is rebuilding their data/analytics department and is currently building a team that will create a data mesh set-up for the company. The team will work in collaboration with different teams throughout the company, assisting them in creating valuable data insights. As an analyst you will work as an internal consultant, sparring with the different teams to see what data insights they need and helping them translate that to the correct variables to measue, configure their Dashboards properly and help them set=up effective usage. If things are done you will start the same puzzle again with the next team!

We are looking for data engineers who bring:

At least 5 years’ experience in IT/Data of which 3+ on Analytics.
Strong SQL skills and preferably some Python as well.
Excellent communicator and proactive person.
Strong experience with Dasboarding, PowerBI or similar.

So, are you looking to work in a team that is making in impact in a large and critical organization? Are you interested in the puzzle of Data Mesh, Dashboarding and Financial complexity? Please apply!

Salary: up to 75k

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Specialist to join a dynamic Content Management team. This role focuses on supporting key areas such as Ratings & Reviews (R&R) and User-Generated Content (UGC) in an eCommerce setting. You'll work across both front-end and back-end functions to optimize how content is displayed, monitored, and validated.




Key Responsibilities




Collaborate on ideas, designs, and hypotheses to enhance features on the website and app.
Conduct A/B testing using tools like Optimizely Feature Experimentation and in-house analytics platforms.
Align with stakeholders to communicate updates and changes across various touchpoints.
Maintain and optimize dashboards in Looker Studio to provide insights on team performance.
Support processes for review and image submission validation using SQL and relevant tools.




Broader Initiatives:

Contribute to strategic projects, including transitioning to a headless CMS and improving content performance visibility.
Provide input on performance metrics, OKRs, and monitoring strategies for data-driven decision-making.







Essential Skills

Strong analytical skills and proficiency in SQL.
Knowledge of experimentation methods, including A/B testing.
Understanding of funnels and end-to-end processes in content workflows.
Stakeholder management experience with a collaborative approach.




Desirable Skills

Experience with GCP and BigQuery.
Proficiency in Python (Notebooks).
Familiarity with eCommerce environments.
An eagerness to learn and a strong team-player mentality.







What's in It for You?

This is an exciting opportunity to work on impactful projects in a cutting-edge digital environment, where your expertise will play a vital role in enhancing the customer experience.




Randstad area
Hybrid working - you must be located in Netherlands
ZZP or interim payroll
6 months contract (view to extend)
70-75 per hour or €5000 a month







If you have the skills, curiosity, and drive to excel in this role, we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Amsterdam, NL (at least 2 days per week onsite)

Duration: 06 months (with possibility of extension)

Background:

As a data specialist you will be supporting the entire Personalization area of client. While the topic is not new, the way we’ve organized it is.
Previously we’ve focused the efforts in our department on Product Recommendations and Content Recommendations.
With the addition of several teams from elsewhere in the organization, we’ve added new functionalities to our scope.
The teams that were added provide us with customer-specific details by means of an API, have built several models to help us re-organise the layout of entire pages on client.com based on historical behavior and customer details, and provide a sophisticated framework to do nudging and lotteries on client.com using very specific targeting and trigger details.
In this new set-up we’re looking for someone that can help us bridge the gap between teams.

Requirements:

Must: analytical skills, SQL, good stakeholder management, thinking on a more strategic level, certain extent of knowledge or experience when it comes to personalization (e.g. recommender systems, clustering / segmentation, modelling techniques for prediction).
Nice: experience with GCP, Big Query, Python (Notebooks), familiar in an FMCG of retail sector, eager to learn, familiar in an eCommerce environment, experience building more strategic plans, experience with building business cases or assessing potential monetary gains on a complex topic

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
BI Specialist

Location: Amsterdam (Hybrid – 2 days in the office)

About the Company

We are a leader in innovative data solutions for the mobility sector. With over 10 years of market experience, we connect mobility companies with intelligent processes and reliable data. We empower our clients with insights to drive their business forward. Our company is part of a trusted network that helps mobility companies succeed with solutions ranging from insurance to data-driven products.

Your Role

As a BI Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in translating complex information into actionable insights. Using your expertise in BI solutions and visualization tools like Power BI, you will build insightful dashboards for both internal and external stakeholders. Your contributions will directly support the management team in making data-driven decisions and help in the development of new data products for the mobility sector.

You will collaborate with Data Engineers to extract data from our platform and transform it into visually appealing reports that make it easier for business leaders to act on critical information. You’ll be part of an agile team, handling complex tasks and contributing to the development of our data-driven solutions.

Responsibilities

Design and develop BI solutions using Power BI, SQL Server, and Azure.
Collaborate with Data Engineers to ensure the availability of clean and accurate data.
Build financial and KPI dashboards to support decision-making.
Contribute to the development of new information products for the mobility sector.
Act as a bridge between technical teams and non-technical stakeholders to communicate data insights effectively.
Work independently to tackle complex tasks and prioritize them in an agile environment.

What We Are Looking For

6+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, working with both front-end and back-end BI solutions.
Proficient in Microsoft BI stack: SQL Server, Azure, Power BI, and ETL processes.
Experience in building KPI and financial dashboards.
Familiarity with dbt, Databricks, and Google BigQuery is a plus.
Recent certifications in Azure AI Fundamentals and Dynamics 365 are a plus.
Proficiency in Dutch (both written and spoken).
Strong communication skills, able to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Job Description

As Business Data Analyst you are part of Customer Excellence Team, supporting and facilitating our organization with data analytics and enabling effective decision making. In close cooperation with your colleagues in Customer Excellence, Business Technology Services and the various business stakeholders, you transform market and customer data into sustainable dashboards / analytical reports based on business use cases. The ideal candidate has a strong affinity with data analytics and the health care environment, is a quick learner and brings a positive can-do mentality. You will report to the Manager Business Analytics.

Key Responsibilities


Analytics & Reporting - Understand, combine and transform local & global datasets into visualizations. Build sustainable dashboards (PowerBI) to support both operational reporting and strategic decision making. Guide colleagues to develop right visualizations for presenting results.
Data modeling - Understand and further optimize the data models of current use cases. Develop data models for new use cases. Help manage the various data models which enable business users to answer their questions.
Data governance - Partner with internal stakeholders from different departments to help shape how we manage customer data, to ensure alignment and to maintain analytical tools sustainable and compliant.
State-of-the-art data platform – opportunity to familiarize yourself with a state-of-the-art data platform (Palantir Foundry)
Innovation - Explore and innovate new solutions and capabilities in the areas of data, analytics, and AI to address business issues and opportunities.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s or higher degree with academic courses in quantitative methods, analytics, statistics, economics or finance.
Experience in a corporate environment & experience with relevant customer / market datasets within the biopharmaceutical industry is a plus.
Analytically strong. Ability to rapidly connect & match analytics and data products to business needs. Able to analyze and draw meaningful conclusions from data. Affinity with relational database query languages using SQL.
You need to be able to quickly be in the driver’s seat and work on the different use cases with the ability to quickly learn the new environment and Palantir Foundry platform.
Expert knowledge of an analysis tool such as Microsoft PowerBI and curious to learn more about their platforms. Passionate about technology and excited about the impact of emerging / disruptive technologies.
Gives importance to creating sustainable, well-documented, compliant data solutions.
Great collaborator and excellent written and verbal communications skills
Ability to independently frame business questions, identify data sources, formulate a methodology and manage project timelines and deliverables.
Fluent in both English and preferably Dutch, with excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Wil jij advies geven over commerciële en strategische beslissingen aan Royal FloraHolland en onze klanten? Ben jij een kei met Power BI (of andere dashboarding)? Maak jij de mooiste datamodellen en analyses? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!




Over Royal FloraHolland

Het is onze ambitie om ons te ontwikkelen tot dé marktplaats voor bloemen en planten. We investeren in onze fysieke en digitale marktplaats, ons logistieke- en financiële dienstenpakket om onze kwekers en overige klanten maximaal van dienst te kunnen zijn. Daarnaast investeren we fors in onze mensen, zetten in op ontwikkeling, opleiding en duurzame inzetbaarheid zodat we samen in staat zijn elke dag een stap extra te zetten, onze meerwaarde voor kweker en klant te bewijzen en onze ambities waar te maken.




Market Intelligence

Als Data Analist maak je deel uit van het team Market Intelligence samen met 14 andere collega’s. Dit team bestaat uit Analisten en Marktonderzoekers en is essentieel voor het werken en verbeteren met data binnen en buiten Royal FloraHolland. Samen zorg je ervoor dat zowel senior management als ‘mensen op de vloer’ aan de slag kunnen met data. De scope is hierbij groot en we pionieren dan ook continu naar nieuwe mogelijkheden voor betere besluitvorming. Je kunt hierbij denken aan dashboarding, strategische analyses, voorspelmodellen, onderzoek, simulaties en meer. Goed om te weten: Market Intelligence is een team waar samenwerken hoog in het vaandel staat en waar we elkaar actief opzoeken en samen groeien.




Functieomschrijving

Als Data Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het structureren van commerciële, operationele en klantgedrag data. Je bewaakt de datakwaliteit en voert analyses uit. Je weet hoe je aantrekkelijke dashboards maakt en resultaten vanuit analyses samen met actiegerichte inzichten presenteert. Op basis hiervan nemen Royal FloraHolland en haar klanten relevante commerciële en strategische beslissingen. Je signaleert, analyseert en adviseert over kansen, behoeften en ontwikkelingen in de markt. Op deze manier bestrijk je een heel spectrum van strategische, tactische en operationele vraagstukken.




Je ontwikkelt samen met de andere Analisten een visie en strategie over hoe RFH nu en in de toekomst commerciële, klant en marktdata optimaal inzet t.b.v. betere besluitvorming.;
Je bent in staat data uit verschillende bronnen te verzamelen bijvoorbeeld door het koppelen met verschillende databronnen. Je weet hier de beste insights uit te halen en geeft concreet advies.
Je hebt affiniteit met tooling zoals SQL en Python om complexe analyses terug te brengen naar een eenduidig antwoord.
Je stelt je op als kwantitatief expert en bent daarmee medeverantwoordelijk voor de dashboarding vanuit het team.
Je bent in staat jouw dashboards en analyses op een aantrekkelijke en doortastende manier te presenteren. Het is voor de gebruiker leuk en prikkelend om verder aan de slag te gaan met het werk dat je oplevert.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About Royaltyport:

Royaltyport assists artists and their managers in managing their music business intelligently. Our mission is to ensure artists understand their rights and income, receiving fair compensation. Founded by seasoned entrepreneurs with extensive music industry expertise, Royaltyport has recently launched its product and is already collaborating with artists like Sam Feldt, Purple Disco Machine, Oliver Heldens, and John Newman.




About You:

We’re looking for a passionate data analyst intern to join our team. You’ll collaborate closely with seasoned startup founders, experienced engineers, and our expert data lead.




Musicians receive revenue reports in various formats and from multiple sources. Your role will involve identifying errors in the data and visualising it in a way that is clear and actionable for our artists. This could involve areas of underpayment, errors in royalty calculations, or missing payments altogether. You will focus on both novel and common reporting errors in the industry. Additionally, you will become an expert on different types of royalties and develop expertise in musical earnings over the course of your internship.




We’re seeking someone who learns quickly and is eager to dive in and make a meaningful impact. If you’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves and want to play a role in a changing industry, we’d love to hear from you.




Requirements:

Must-Have:
Students pursuing an academic university degree or recent graduates in econometrics, data science, statistics, or computer/information sciences.
Strong knowledge of SQL.
Strong analytical capabilities.
Eligibility to work in the Netherlands.
Bonus Points For:
Experience with Looker Studio or visualisation platforms like PowerBi or Tableau.
Experience in Python.
Any analytical work experience.
Any kind of pre existing knowledge on music royalties.




Our Ideal Candidate:

Believes in our mission.
Able to work independently.
Thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Is available at least 3 days a week, and can frequently come to our office in Amsterdam.
Passion for music and the music industry is a plus, though not required.
Proficiency in Dutch is a plus, though not required.




What We Offer:

An opportunity to work in the music industry and gain a unique peek behind the curtain.
An internship allowance available.
Learn for experienced data professionals and startup founders.




What’s next:

If you’re excited about this opportunity, send your information to hello@royaltyport.com. Sharing previous work, if applicable, is highly encouraged. The first step is an initial online meeting, followed by an in-person meeting if there’s a good fit.

Title: Sustainability Data Analysis
Description:
Sustainability Data Analyst




Introduction

Within Corporate EHS (Environment, Health and Safety), we play a key role in delivering environmental data for annual reporting and supporting the business sectors with data analysis on waste and emissions. Currently, we are seeking an expert to conduct in-depth analyses of existing waste data. The focus will be on identifying hotspots and best practices across locations, sectors, waste types, and disposal methods. The role also involves engaging with internal stakeholders to communicate findings and drive initiatives that enable structural improvements in circular economy practices.




Role and Responsibilities

As an EHS Sustainability Data Analyst, you will focus on analyzing waste data to identify opportunities for improvement and providing actionable insights to internal stakeholders. Your responsibilities include:

Performing in-depth analyses of collected waste data to identify improvement areas.
Collaborating with internal stakeholders to drive waste reduction and circular economy initiatives.
Conducting data quality checks to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Supporting sustainability improvement projects within business sectors.




Education and Experience

BSc / MSc degree in an environmental or waste management-related field.
3+ years of relevant experience in sustainability, environmental management, or waste analysis.
Proven skills in data analysis, with the ability to derive actionable insights.
Strong stakeholder management skills to engage with and influence internal teams.
Familiarity with data tools and analysis software such as PowerBI and/or Spotfire is advantageous.




Key Qualifications

Expertise in waste management or environmental topics is a strong preference.
A proactive and collaborative mindset to work effectively in a cross-functional environment.




The project has a minimum duration of 6 months with a possible extension.

Freelance is also an option.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We help companies modernize business operations, adopt intelligent automation, deliver real-time performance insights and connect the enterprise - accelerating the impact of digital transformation. Founded in 1987 and recognized as a trusted advisor, HSO is one of the world's top business solution and implementation partners, large enough to serve, small enough to care. We are 100% dedicated to Microsoft technology, with practices that offer our clients a complete set of Microsoft cloud solutions from a single global partner. HSO is a proven global leader with unique delivery capabilities offered from our dedicated Microsoft practices in more than 30 offices across the Americas, Europe, Australia and Asia.

HSO is a Gold Certified partner since 2002 and since 2006 has been a part of the Microsoft Dynamics Inner Circle, a prestige reserved for just 1% of Microsoft partners worldwide. Within HSO you'll work with Microsoft Dynamics 365, Azure cloud platform and our unique, industry-specific solutions.

We are a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to leveraging data to drive business insights and decisions. Our team is passionate about technology and data, and we are looking for a talented Data Engineer / Data Analyst to join us.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes
Analyze complex datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data warehouses
Create and manage dashboards and reports to visualize data trends and metrics
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation
Optimize data processes for performance and scalability



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, or in a similar role
Proficiency in Fabric, SQL, Python, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities



Benefits

Why choose HSO?

Freedom and flexibility

An organization with a lot of professional freedom and flexibility where we make the best choices together to optimize your development process during your career.

Culture

An open and accessible work environment full of colleagues who are always there for each other. We are one big HSO Team. Because without cooperation and fun, there is no success!

Development and growth

A job with plenty of growth opportunities in an organisation with an eye for your talents, ambitions and the things that drive you.

A good remuneration package

An excellent salary and fringe benefits include a laptop, mobile phone, flexible incentive plan, large office offering a collaborative environment with a modern design and free parking in Amsterdam.

Do you want to be part of a fast-growing company and work with many international colleagues? Then you can apply immediately!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join us at Playtika (NASDAQ: PLTK), where we're driven by the belief life needs play. We’re on a mission to deliver infinite ways to play using cutting-edge technologies like AI and machine learning to craft immersive experiences that connect, inspire and entertain millions of players worldwide.

From our start as a small mobile games company founded in Israel to our current position as a publicly traded company and industry leader, we continue to be a dominant force in interactive entertainment. With a diverse portfolio of award-winning, category-leading Casual and Social Casino-themed games, including nine of the top 100 highest-grossing mobile games in the US, we're setting the standard for excellence.

Our success story is co-authored by a dynamic team of storytellers, strategists, creators and data scientists who thrive on innovation. We are home of the best, advancing an inclusive culture that embraces our core values and reflects our agile DNA.

With a strong financial foundation, disciplined operations, unwavering player-focused approach and relentless can-do spirit, we're well-positioned for sustained growth. If you're ready to join the driving force behind the evolution of interactive entertainment, we invite you to come play with us.




We are looking for someone who lives in Amsterdam and is ready to work in a hybrid mode (with 2-3 days in the office).




About Youda Games

We are growing! Therefore, we are looking for a talented BUSINESS ANALYST for our studio in Amsterdam. Better known as YOUDA GAMES. From our studio we supply the world with Governor of Poker 3 and Monopoly Poker.

We want users to have a fun time playing our games, it’s that simple. Making games our fans can’t stop playing is our goal. Our studio is loaded with motivated, talented and creative people that will make any possible effort to fulfill our promise. We are fast-paced, nimble and laugh a lot, at least we try to 😉

We work hard, but also prioritize our fun, collaborative and well-balanced culture.




ABOUT THE JOB!

Business Analytics Playtikans have a talent for identifying bottlenecks and areas of growth potential using their ANALYTICAL skills. And want to work at a growing international company with great perks and benefits.




Responsibilities:

As a Business Analyst you'll embark on an epic quest to wield data as your weapon and conquer the challenges of user engagement, growth, and monetization. You’ll join forces with our product managers and game makers to unlock the secrets of gameplay enhancement and user retention, all while enjoying the excitement of the gaming universe!

Last but not least you’re able to tell the data as a story and make it accessible through proper visualization for the rest of the studio.

Requirements:

5+ years of big data analytics, preferably for a web or mobile company, or in the online gaming industry
Extensive experience in SQL, including daily use and a deep understanding of window functions and partitions for advanced data analysis and reporting
Proven ability to create simple yet impactful visualizations that are intuitive, easy to interpret, and demonstrate strong attention to detail, ensuring clarity and effectiveness in communicating insights (preferably in Tableau)
Ability to work independently and deliver actionable insights and recommendations to support business decisions
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills to identify key trends and patterns in player data, with strong attention to detail
Great communication skills – someone who can translate complex data into actionable insights for stakeholders
A team player that can work effectively with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment




Nice To Have’s:

Be a gamer yourself - genuine passion for video games and an understanding of what makes games fun and engaging for players
Experience with A/B testing in a live game/service environment, including results analysis and interpretation
Knowledge of statistics, predictive models and machine learning techniques (Python, R)




Here’s What We Offer You:

A challenging role in a diverse, international and fast-growing organization with lots of career opportunities
Hybrid ways of working between home and the office
A competitive monthly salary
Bonus incentive
Monthly Phone Allowance
Participation in our pension scheme
26 vacation days
6 powerup weekends
1 day off for your birthday
Lunch benefit
Christmas, Birthday & Special events gifts




We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

If you feel the above describes you perfectly - Apply now!

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst
HTML:
Our client

Our client is a leading ISP and Network Provider in the Utrecht area, renowned for delivering reliable, high-performance internet and network solutions. Their in-house development team is passionate, collaborative, and continuously striving to innovate. The role

As a Data & Reporting Specialist, your primary focus will be on developing and maintaining high-quality Power BI reports and dashboards. You will play a key role in transforming raw data into meaningful insights that support decision-making across the organization. Your expertise in Power BI, combined with a strong understanding of business needs, will help shape our client's reporting strategy and ensure that the teams have the data they need at their fingertips.


Tasks & Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain interactive and visually appealing Power BI reports, dashboards and apps.

  • Develop and implement reporting standards and best practices to ensure consistency and accuracy across all reports;

  • Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality, accurate reports and UX;

  • A proactive, solution-oriented attitude and a passion for data-driven decision-making;
  • Enthusiasm for continuous learning and keeping up with the latest developments in Power BI and data visualization;
  • And most of all you are a team player that also loves to actively participate in (often sporty 😊) team events.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
How do you delight our customers?

Bol continuously advances its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and over 50,000 trading partners. Our Advertising via bol (Avb) propositions, which help shoppers discover products and help advertisers reach shoppers, play an important role in bol’s ambitions – and this is where you’ll make the difference. As Avb Marketing, we help and engage thousands of our advertisers.

Marketing Analytics play an instrumental role here. Our goal is to enable ‘Engagement at Scale’. As a Marketing Data Analyst, you’ll analyze our advertising partners’ behavior, uncover opportunities for improvement and share actionable insights with our marketeers so that our campaigns reach the right audience at the right time. In all your decisions, you’ll take scalability into account as we serve thousands of active advertisers at any given moment.

The biggest challenge

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and becoming increasingly important for bol. The number of colleagues, the complexity of the tech, and the breadth of initiatives are rapidly expanding. Data needs and requests for more insights are no exception. At the same time, we’re implementing Marketing Automation tools to improve our capabilities. This requires us to work pragmatically and focus on achieving the required outcomes. You rise to the occasion to ensure that the underlying data of our campaigns is robust, can be used effectively and responsibly and iterate quickly.

What You’ll Do As An Marketing Data Analyst

You’ll join a team of marketing data analysts in bol’s Avb Marketing Analytics team, which aims to help the marketing teams to create more engaging and impactful campaigns through data.

Your Workload Covers Three Main Areas


You help our marketeers by creating insights to understand advertiser behavior, help optimize campaigns, and drive data-driven decisions. All with the goal of building and optimizing campaigns that help and engage advertisers
You help build, maintain and simplify our data model that supports our communication flows. All with the goal of enabling scalable campaigning where we reach thousands of advertisers at a relevant moment
You analyze the performance of our campaigns and attribute their commercial value. All with the goal of identifying opportunities for improvement and getting a clear picture of the impact we’re making as a department


We’re Looking For You If You


Don’t want to work alone. You work closely with various stakeholders to make the above possible. This requires strong communication skills to bridge the gap between Marketeers, Analysts and Product Engineers;
Challenge ideas. You help the team with the other Marketing data analysts to reach a higher level, both in terms of content and on a personal level.
Help implement best practice around tools and concepts like: Git, SQL, Dbt, data testing, monitoring, and alerting, to create a state-of-the-art analytics environment that enforces quality standards;
Help model pipelines, optimize queries, and apply best practices. You also actively collaborate within bol’s wider analytics engineering and data engineering community to improve our data stack at scale;
Practice and preach Clean Code principles such as DRY and Clean, Clear and Concise;
Know a thing or two about data engineering, analytics engineering or business intelligence engineering and know your way around a marketing automation tooling (such as Marigold Engage).


3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


Uncomfortable with ambiguity Our data landscape evolves, and you’ll need to navigate it confidently, so an entrepreneurial mindset is a must. Bol is complex, you have to involve and convince both Product & Tech colleagues to find solutions, proactively and autonomously.
Output over outcome If your work ends when you complete a dashboard – who cares how users experience it – then this job is not for you. We’re looking to find real solutions for our marketing teams to build solid campaigns!
No continuous improvement We’re always learning from our analyses and work to improve our ways-of-working.
Sharing is caring You have hands-on experience in marketing analytics, SQL (e.g. BigQuery), statistics (the basics) and feel comfortable navigating and analyzing large, complex datasets.
High quality code results in clear and actionable insights Finetuning queries, data models, and coding principles make you smile and SQL, Git and dashboarding tools like Tableau/Looker Studio are your home away from home. *Dbt and/or Airflow is a plus.
You are not a one-trick-pony Our role is multi-faceted so you can translate data to opportunity and opportunity to campaign building blocks. It starts with extracting campaign opportunities from data and ends with realizing the data foundation for scalable marketing campaigns.


This is where you’ll work

You’ll join a team of four Marketing Data Analysts which supports our multidisciplinary Avb Marketing team. Your marketing colleagues are seasoned in the world of data and CRM. Sparring happens on a daily basis. We like to make each other better – motivating and respecting are second nature to us.

Besides the strategic topics, you have the space to work on your own innovations and seize the opportunities you identify. Bol gladly invests in your personal and professional growth; development is a primary employment condition. The culture is informal, down-to-earth, and pioneering.

We work in collaborative spaces where you’ll work alongside other data enthusiasts, enjoying a mix of open areas and quiet corners. Our most important stakeholders in Marketing, Sales and Product are just a stroll away.

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

Title: Data-analist
HTML:
Lijkt het jou een mooie uitdaging om HalloStroom een stap verder te helpen? Weet jij dat te realiseren middels data analyses en onderbouwde marketing strategieën? Dan ben jij misschien wel de Data Analist die wij zoeken. Lees snel verder.


Wie ben jij?

Als Data Analist bij HalloStroom sta je voor een mooie uitdaging. Jouw doel is namelijk om de groei van HalloStroom te versnellen, door duurzame energietoepassingen te promoten. Dit doe je middels onderbouwde, data gedreven en innovatieve marketing strategieën, waarmee je ervoor zorgt dat nieuwe klanten worden aangetrokken en er cross-sell mogelijkheden worden benut bij bestaande klanten. Er is in de afgelopen jaren een hoop data verzameld. Daarom zoeken we iemand die deze data kan bundelen en om kan zetten in acties die meer verkoop genereren. De kern van je functie bestaat dan ook uit het identificeren van groeikansen. Dit doe je door het verzamelen en samenstellen van data, waaruit je inzichten opdoet. Op basis van deze inzichten en datasets stel je marketingcampagnes op, waarvan je de data weer analyseert om deze te verbeteren. Zo zorg je voor kosten efficiëntie, en realiseer je groei. In deze functie werk je nauw samen met het marketing en sales team. Je rapporteert direct aan de CCO.


Jouw hoofdverantwoordelijkheden:

  • Ontwikkelen van data gedreven strategieën om klantvoorkeuren, markttrends en groeikansen te identificeren.
  • Het vinden, genereren en samenstellen van grote datasets uit verschillende databronnen om kostenefficiënte marketingcampagnes te lanceren.
  • Optimaliseren van marketingfunnels om klantinschrijvingen te stimuleren.
  • Voorbereiden van rapportages en inzichtelijk maken data.
  • Deelnemen aan creatieve brainstormsessies voor nieuwe marketinginitiatieven.
  • Uitvoeren van een data gedreven aanpak voor sociale media, e-mailmarketing, SEO/SEM, etc.


Wie ben jij?

  • Jij bent data-gedreven, proactief en wilt groei realiseren voor HalloStroom.
  • Je hebt ervaring met data-analyse tools en bent in staat om inzichten te vertalen naar concrete optimalisaties;
  • Je hebt kennis van tools zoals BigQuery, Tableau of Power BI;
  • Je bent bekend met het gebruik van APIs en SQL om data op te halen en te integreren in databases;
  • Daarnaast heb je ook kennis van digital marketing, zoals SEO, SEM en socials;
  • Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden waarmee je complexe concepten op een duidelijke en overtuigende manier weet over te brengen.


Wat bieden wij jou?

Duurzaam voor jou! geldt zeker ook voor onze collega's. Werken bij HalloStroom wil zeggen dat je onderdeel wordt van een gezellig en informeel team dat altijd voor elkaar klaarstaat. Wij gaan met elkaar (en met onze klanten) om zoals wij ook met vrienden en familie omgaan. We zijn een jong, energiek bedrijf op weg naar onze duurzame missie.

Je kunt het volgende verwachten:

  • Een salaris tussen de €3700,- en €4700,- per maand, afhankelijk van jouw ervaring en expertise;
  • 25 vakantiedagen bij een fulltime dienstverband;
  • 8% vakantiegeld en reiskostenvergoeding: km-vergoeding voor woon-werkverkeer of een NS-Business Card;
  • Flexibele pensioenregeling;
  • Vers fruit op kantoor;
  • De mogelijkheid om gebruik te maken van de fitnessruimte of korting op je sport abonnement;
  • Een uitdagende functie met veel vrijheid binnen een snelgroeiende en veranderende markt;
  • Leuke uitjes en borrels met je collega's.


Wie zijn wij?

Wij zijn HalloStroom! Opgericht in 2016 als een ambitieuze start-up en inmiddels uitgegroeid tot een volwassen speler in de duurzame energiemarkt. Van het verhuren van zonnepanelen zijn we doorontwikkeld naar een totaalleverancier van duurzame energie-oplossingen, zoals thuisbatterijen met dynamische energiecontracten waarmee we kunnen handelen op de energiemarkten. Alles toegankelijk voor een breed publiek. We zijn de one-stop-shop voor iedereen die zonder investering en gedoe wil overstappen naar een duurzame energievoorziening. Bij HalloStroom streven we ernaar de wereld te verbeteren met oplossingen die duurzaam, leuk en economisch voordelig zijn. Duurzaam in jouw voordeel dus.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ready to visualize data and drive insight? At YoungOnes, you'll play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights. We're looking for a Data Analyst who is passionate about creating compelling dashboards and visualizations, as well as supporting various departments in optimizing their data utilization. Join our dynamic, fast-growing tech scale-up and help us shape the future of data-driven decision making. And most importantly, really create an impact in the company.




WHAT YOU'LL DO

YoungOnes is an ambitious tech platform that connects young talent with clients across the Netherlands, United Kingdom, and France. In this international environment, you’ll collaborate closely with both Dutch and English-speaking colleagues.

As a Data Analyst, your primary responsibility will be developing impactful dashboards and visualizations that transform data into easily digestible insights for various teams. In addition, you’ll actively engage with teams to understand and provide solutions to their everyday data needs, ensuring that data serves its purpose for continuous improvement.

You’ll join our Data team and work closely with colleagues across the organization. Your role will be instrumental in helping teams focus on what’s important through continuous analysis and timely delivery of insights, using data from the Azure stack alongside tools like Databricks, Databases and Power BI.




WHAT WE OFFER

A gross salary of €3,000 to €5,000 based on 40 hours per week (dependent on experience and skills).
25 vacation days, 6.5 ADV days, and 1 extra holiday per year.
A quarterly bonus (based on company performance).
8% holiday pay, pension scheme, and travel reimbursement (if living more than 10km from the office).
The chance to grow and develop within our international scale-up.
Resources and opportunities for personal development.
Attention to mental well-being, in partnership with OpenUp.
Great perks such as a €150 sports budget, daily fresh lunches, healthy snacks, biweekly get-togethers, our own festival, padel tournaments, and incentive trips like skiing.




WHO YOU ARE

HBO/WO level thinking and working capabilities.
0-3 years of experience in a relevant field.
Strong aptitude for creating data visualizations and dashboards.
Proficient in SQL & DAX.
Experience with Power BI.
Communicative and eager to learn.
Preferred Dutch speaker.
Passionate about using data to drive improvements.
Collaborative and supportive in team environments.
Willing to be in the Breda office 3 to 4 days a week.

Title: Business data analyst
HTML:
Business Data Analyst

Heb jij een sterk analytisch denkvermogen en een kritische blik? Heb je ervaring met het omzetten van bedrijfsdata in waardevolle inzichten en wil je organisaties helpen om datagedreven beslissingen te maken? Dan ben jij de Business Data Analyst waar wij naar op zoek zijn.


Deze functie is landelijk georiënteerd maar kent een positionering vanuit Utrecht.


Wat doe je als Business Data Analyst?

Spotta is het bedrijf achter het folderpakket dat huishoudens wekelijks thuisbezorgd krijgen. Spotta heeft hiervoor 21.000 bezorgers die wijken in Nederland lopen om het pakket te bezorgen. Als Business Data Analyst zorg je ervoor dat strategische bedrijfsdoelen vertaald worden naar meetbare en bruikbare inzichten. Je haalt inzicht uit onze bedrijfsdata, met als doel het creëren van een optimaal bezorgnetwerk. Je denkt na over de wijktijd bepaling (hoe lang een bezorger doet over het lopen van de wijk) en zorgt ervoor dat dit in balans is met de verdienkansen van de bezorgers. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de inzet, opbouw en optimalisatie van het vergoedingenmodel van bezorgers. Je analyseert het beleidsmodel van verlonen en doet verbetervoorstellen. Dit doe je in samenwerking met afdelingen zoals Business Intelligence en Informatie Management, waarbij je op basis van data de wijkindelingen en verdienkansen kan bepalen.


Verder:

  • Ben je verantwoordelijk voor het maken van KPI’s wijkindelingen en het sturen/monitoren hierop;
  • Zorg je dat het bezorgnetwerk continue verbetert;
  • Speel je een leidende rol bij de planning & uitvoer van grootschalige, kolom-overstijgende projecten van het bezorgnetwerk. Je denkt mee op strategisch niveau waarbij je rekening houdt met de doelen en beschikbare middelen;
  • Bouw en onderhoud je relaties met interne en externe stakeholders, waarmee je rekening houdt met verschillende belangen.


Hierin herken jij jezelf:

Je bent in staat continu verbeterpotentieel uit de data te signaleren, dit om te zetten naar concrete verbetervoorstellen, te delen met collega’s, en te implementeren. Daarnaast ben je vaardig in het werken met data-analyses, en het opstellen van en sturen op budgetten. Verder:

  • Heb je HBO+/ WO werk- en denkniveau, bij voorkeur met een technische achtergrond;
  • Krijg je energie van het duiken in getallen en projectmatig werk;
  • Heb je het vermogen om in een zeer dynamische werkomgeving het overzicht te bewaren;
  • Heb je een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk;
  • Heb je minimaal 5 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare rol.


Ben je tot slot een echte lekkerbek? Dan pas je perfect in het team Bezorgen! Op dinsdag hebben we altijd een MT-lunch, waarbij we een creatieve en lekkere lunch meenemen.


Waarom werken bij Spotta?

  • Er is ruimte voor nieuwe initiatieven en ideeën, of je nu een week, een maand of tien jaar bij ons werkt;
  • Je krijgt veel vrijheid en vertrouwen om jouw werk zo in te delen als voor jou fijn is;
  • Je krijgt veel ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden;
  • We zijn een platte, informele organisatie met een goede werksfeer;
  • We zitten in een transitiefase waarbij we met zijn allen streven naar een duurzame en slimme manier van het verspreiden van folders;
  • We zijn een diverse en inclusieve organisatie, zo werken er maar liefst 22 verschillende nationaliteiten;

Naast hard werken, is er bij Spotta ook ruimte voor plezier! Er worden regelmatig domibo’s en teamuitjes georganiseerd. Ook krijgen we jaarlijks onze dosis modder tijdens Mud Masters (als je wilt).


Dit bieden wij jou:

  • De arbeidsvoorwaarden van Spotta zijn van toepassing waarbij de functie wordt ingedeeld in schaal 11: minimumsalaris € 3.784,51 en maximum € 5.630,87 bruto op fulltime basis;
  • Minimaal 30 vakantiedagen op fulltime basis, met de optie om bij te kopen;
  • Thuiswerkvergoeding;
  • Een bedrijfsauto;
  • Een goede pensioenregeling;
  • Een winstafhankelijke bonus.


Past deze functie bij jou? Solliciteer!*

Wil je eerst meer weten over de vacature? Stuur dan een mail naar Mick Brants, via mick.brants@spotta.nl.

We are excited to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces by Fortune Magazine!

About Us

Stryker is one of the world’s top medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people live more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst Intern in Stryker, you will be immersed in analysing various datapoints to help Stryker deliver its growth strategy in Europe. Together with the Analytics team you will create scalable, investigative capabilities which enable the Division commercial teams to reduce time spent on data searching, cleaning, reporting and shift focus towards running the business with supporting facts, insights, and foresights. This role is perfect for highly analytically minded individuals looking to impact healthcare through technology. This hands-on internship offers a unique opportunity to contribute to create a data culture in Stryker and gain valuable industry experience.

Opportunities & Benefits That The Role Offers


Opportunity to work on fulfilling and future focused projects, which will contribute to our continued commercial success within the division.
This position offers excellent opportunities of personal development including stakeholder management within an international medical device company, working together with both functional stakeholders, COE team-members and Divisional senior management.
Help shape the future of the COE Analytics team in Europe, to ensure the team provide best in class service to our commercial divisions.
Work in Europe’s 6th best “Great Place to Work”.


What will you do at Stryker?


Translate stakeholder requirements to potential data analytics
Generate competitive and actionable insights by analyzing sales and product data
Conduct analysis for various markets and divisions, from problem and requirements definition to code validation and deployment.
Support in the creation of scalable and efficient data capabilities (incl. external data sources)
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales operation analyst, commercial analysts and BI analysts to support insight generation
Build and improve SQL queries, Power BI dashboards and automate processes that will gear the reporting and insights capabilities.
Help in the preparation of reports and presentations that communicate research findings and marketing insights to internal stakeholders.


Is this you?


Currently pursuing a master's or bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Analytics, Statistics/Mathematics/Economics, Business Administration or a related field.
Strong analytical skills and an ability to interpret data to derive meaningful insights.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Proficient in English
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment as well as independently.
You have knowledge in Data governance concepts including the need for documented definitions, calculations, sources, lineage, etc.
Experienced in at least one of the tools central to data analytics: SQL, Python, Power BI, DAX


You love a Challenge A self-starter who enjoys problem solving and creating innovative solutions.

You Build Relationships You build and maintain successful relationships with key internal and external stakeholders and customers.

You do the Right Thing You have a high level of integrity, responsibility, discipline, and attention to detail. You understand the importance of keeping tabs of what is always going on in your goals/projects.

Location: Amsterdam

Start date: September 1st

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Sony Benelux

Hoofddorp

The Business Intelligence Analyst handles the local data of Sony Netherlands & Belgium and drives maximum automation of the reporting, using Excel, Power BI and Power Automate to collect and retrieve data, crafting valuable business insights and analysis for our Sales and Marketing team. The majority of your role will be dedicated to support our Sales & Marketing teams to create “fit for purpose” reporting and forecasting. The other part is to support our data-driven Retail Activation team, where speed and flexibility is highly meaningful.

You will be part of our small Sales & Marketing Strategy team, where our work is essential to the efficiency and effectiveness of the entire organisation. We are collaborating closely every day with our Sales, Product Marketing, Channel Marketing, Controlling and Retail Activation teams to continuously improve our ways of working. For the candidate with a strong business insight, there will be opportunities to grow into roles in these teams.

Your will


Be responsible for the reporting transition from Excel to Power BI for our region. This includes structuring our local data, automate the ingestion into the data lake, develop retrieval methods to Power BI and Excel, data model creation and visual report design.
Propose and facilitate improvements and reporting automation based on requirement analysis (identify, analyse, categorise, prioritise) for the Sales, Marketing and Retail Activation departments.
Own and drive the monthly business planning (forecast) process to ensure timeliness and quality in the work from the Sales and Marketing teams.
Maintain and further develop Excel-based calculation models and tools for business planning and pricing.
Hands-on support to your colleagues to get the maximum out of the tools and reports.
Respond to ad hoc data requests, quickly understand the needs, and determine the best and most robust way to provide the data in its business context.
Implement European led projects that will need local support.


Your will bring

The ideal candidate possesses an in-depth understanding of the end-to-end processes in a commercial sales and marketing company, and preferably a flair for consumer electronics products.

Understanding the meaning of the numbers in the data and how they impact the business in order to contribute customer value.

The key technical requirements for the job are centric on Microsoft business intelligence tools, primarily Power BI, Power Automate and Excel, and you need to be familiar with the Power BI data model, Power Query and DAX to build efficient and effective visualisations of the data. Knowledge of SAP Analysis for Office and VBA for Excel will be an advantage.

Your report visuals look magnificent, they combine different data sources to provide new insights and are easy to use for the community. In addition, it would be beneficial if you are a digital champion that knows all Microsoft applications and can bring our colleagues into the 21st century. Any interest and experience with generative AI will be considered as an advantage.

You thrive in an environment where you will flexibly change between accurately organising our data, working on long-term improvement projects, and responding to short-term requests for data and insights. In other words, someone who enjoys "getting on with it" and driving a positive change for your team.

Language requirements: Dutch (native or minimum B2 level, conversational and written), plus sophisticated business English.

The position will be based in our Hoofddorp office with occasional travel to our other office(s) as the need arises.

Your new office

Our office is located close to Schiphol Airport and Hoofddorp station in Park20|20. It’s a 5 min walk from the train station, it has parking space with charging facilities underneath as well as a bike shed. Our office is one floor, equipped with all modern workplace necessities. A PS5, Ping pong table and dartboard are available for your moments of connecting and fun and in our coffee corner, alternatively you go for a walk in the park!

Life at Sony

We ensure competitive salaries and benefits by using established benchmarking. We encourage healthy work-life balance supported by hybrid and flexible working policies. We are a positive community who dream big together, respect each other, and enjoy a collaborative culture.

We like to celebrate our colleagues who make a real difference using our recognition platform. We also provide access to numerous services and platforms for all aspects of wellbeing. We listen to our people through conversations and surveys, respect their suggestions, then act on them. We also provide allowances for volunteering days so that our staff can support the causes they are most passionate about.

You can build your career around you with our fantastic range of learning & personal development programs to enhance your skills. We also encourage our staff to try exciting new roles, in a wide range of countries, with a supportive mobility team to support you if you take that leap!

Bring your uniqueness to Sony

We are passionate about creating a culture that promotes equity and cultivates inclusion, diversity, and belonging. We want employees with diverse backgrounds and perspectives that will stimulate innovation and have a direct impact on our creation of social value to fulfil Sony’s purpose – ‘to fill the world with emotion, through the power of creativity and technology’. We want you to bring your unique self to work and help shape our culture.

We are Sony Europe

Our people collaborate in an environment of respect, integrity, and open-mindedness. Diverse teams from all over Europe are the driving force for our business, and we embrace the differences that make each of us original and unique.

With offices in 28 European countries, Sony Europe caters to consumer, professional, semiconductor and healthcare markets with innovative electronics products and solutions. Our European laboratories research and develop new technologies and capabilities that contributes to the Sony Group and important issues on a planetary scale.

Bring your passion, creativity and ambitions to Sony Europe. Apply now, and let’s create the future together.

Equal Opportunity

Sony Europe is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, citizenship, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, medical condition, or any other protected characteristics.

The majority of your role will be dedicated to support our Sales & Marketing teams to create “fit for purpose” reporting and forecasting. The other part is to support our data-driven Retail Activation team, where speed and flexibility is highly meaningful.

You will be part of our small Sales & Marketing Strategy team, where our work is essential to the efficiency and effectiveness of the entire organisation. We are collaborating closely every day with our Sales, Product Marketing, Channel Marketing, Controlling and Retail Activation teams to continuously improve our ways of working. For the candidate with a strong business insight, there will be opportunities to grow into roles in these teams.

Your will

  • Be responsible for the reporting transition from Excel to Power BI for our region. This includes structuring our local data, automate the ingestion into the data lake, develop retrieval methods to Power BI and Excel, data model creation and visual report design.
  • Propose and facilitate improvements and reporting automation based on requirement analysis (identify, analyse, categorise, prioritise) for the Sales, Marketing and Retail Activation departments.
  • Own and drive the monthly business planning (forecast) process to ensure timeliness and quality in the work from the Sales and Marketing teams.
  • Maintain and further develop Excel-based calculation models and tools for business planning and pricing.
  • Hands-on support to your colleagues to get the maximum out of the tools and reports.
  • Respond to ad hoc data requests, quickly understand the needs, and determine the best and most robust way to provide the data in its business context.
  • Implement European led projects that will need local support.

Your will bring

The ideal candidate possesses an in-depth understanding of the end-to-end processes in a commercial sales and marketing company, and preferably a flair for consumer electronics products.

Understanding the meaning of the numbers in the data and how they impact the business in order to contribute customer value.

The key technical requirements for the job are centric on Microsoft business intelligence tools, primarily Power BI, Power Automate and Excel, and you need to be familiar with the Power BI data model, Power Query and DAX to build efficient and effective visualisations of the data. Knowledge of SAP Analysis for Office and VBA for Excel will be an advantage.

Your report visuals look magnificent, they combine different data sources to provide new insights and are easy to use for the community. In addition, it would be beneficial if you are a digital champion that knows all Microsoft applications and can bring our colleagues into the 21st century. Any interest and experience with generative AI will be considered as an advantage.

You thrive in an environment where you will flexibly change between accurately organising our data, working on long-term improvement projects, and responding to short-term requests for data and insights. In other words, someone who enjoys "getting on with it" and driving a positive change for your team.

Language requirements: Dutch (native or minimum B2 level, conversational and written), plus sophisticated business English.

The position will be based in our Hoofddorp office with occasional travel to our other office(s) as the need arises.

Your new office

Our office is located close to Schiphol Airport and Hoofddorp station in Park20|20. It’s a 5 min walk from the train station, it has parking space with charging facilities underneath as well as a bike shed. Our office is one floor, equipped with all modern workplace necessities. A PS5, Ping pong table and dartboard are available for your moments of connecting and fun and in our coffee corner, alternatively you go for a walk in the park!

Life at Sony

We ensure competitive salaries and benefits by using established benchmarking. We encourage healthy work-life balance supported by hybrid and flexible working policies. We are a positive community who dream big together, respect each other, and enjoy a collaborative culture.

We like to celebrate our colleagues who make a real difference using our recognition platform. We also provide access to numerous services and platforms for all aspects of wellbeing. We listen to our people through conversations and surveys, respect their suggestions, then act on them. We also provide allowances for volunteering days so that our staff can support the causes they are most passionate about.

You can build your career around you with our fantastic range of learning & personal development programs to enhance your skills. We also encourage our staff to try exciting new roles, in a wide range of countries, with a supportive mobility team to support you if you take that leap!

Bring your uniqueness to Sony

We are passionate about creating a culture that promotes equity and cultivates inclusion, diversity, and belonging. We want employees with diverse backgrounds and perspectives that will stimulate innovation and have a direct impact on our creation of social value to fulfil Sony’s purpose – ‘to fill the world with emotion, through the power of creativity and technology’. We want you to bring your unique self to work and help shape our culture.

We are Sony Europe

Our people collaborate in an environment of respect, integrity, and open-mindedness. Diverse teams from all over Europe are the driving force for our business, and we embrace the differences that make each of us original and unique.

With offices in 28 European countries, Sony Europe caters to consumer, professional, semiconductor and healthcare markets with innovative electronics products and solutions. Our European laboratories research and develop new technologies and capabilities that contributes to the Sony Group and important issues on a planetary scale.

Bring your passion, creativity and ambitions to Sony Europe. Apply now, and let’s create the future together.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Source.ag is on a mission to produce more fresh fruits and vegetables for more people, through A.I.-powered greenhouses. As a Data Analyst Intern at Source, you will collaborate with Plant Scientists, Data Scientists, and Software Engineers to uncover actionable insights from greenhouse and plant data, enabling growers to optimise yield, costs, and resource usage.




Your role will involve analysing and visualising data, supporting decision-making, and helping develop scalable solutions to improve how data is consumed across teams.




Your project could include one or multiple of the following topics:

Creating interactive dashboards around product usage and performance: Develop SQL and Python based dashboards to visualise how our products are being used and where it performs well and not. This will help our Customer Success Managers to actively help our customers get the best results out of our products and our Product teams to develop new features. You will learn how to leverage data for actionable business insights.




Build pipelines that monitor our production models: Develop Python based pipelines that monitor our cutting edge AI models so that Data Scientists and Software Engineers can easily detect when action is required on our model performance. You will learn how to leverage data for actionable technical and business insights.




Support stakeholder communication around model performance: Join our Lead Data Scientist and help in transparently communicating results from the projects above on a strategic and operational level. You will learn strategic and operational storytelling.




You are

A bachelor’s or master’s student in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Econometrics or a related field.
Experienced with SQL and Python (including data visualisation libraries).
Detail-oriented and analytical, with a passion for uncovering insights from complex datasets.
Available for at least 3 days a week for a minimum duration of 3 months.
Based in the Netherlands

It also includes specialised teams like Retail and Professional Support, as well as the Payment & Wallet team, which oversees treasury operations.

As a Data Specialist in the Operations department, you will leverage your expertise to gather, analyse, and interpret data to optimize operational processes. Partner with the Business Process & Change Manager to derive insights from operational data and implement process improvements

Ensure the integrity and security of data across all systems

Data-analist

(40 uur)




Ben jij een ervaren data-analist die onze ambities op het gebied van data-analyse verder vorm kan geven? Heb je niet alleen de technische expertise, maar ook het talent om teams te verbinden en collega’s te coachen? Dan bieden wij jou de kans om in een rol met zichtbare strategische impact te werken..




Het SRA-Datateam, onderdeel van het businessteam Staf, is een multidisciplinair samenwerkingsverband waarin innovatie centraal staat. Samen met onze IT-adviseur richt jij je volledig op het datateam. Als pionier vertaal je data naar inzichten die onze strategische en operationele doelen versterken. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende teams binnen de organisatie en schakelt actief met onze externe datawarehousepartners. Samen bouwen jullie aan een krachtige datastrategie die ons toekomstbestendig maakt.




Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

Je analyseert grote datasets (financieel en niet- financieel) en vertaalt deze om waardevolle inzichten te creëren.
Je bouwt slimme datamodellen en dashboards om strategische en operationele beslissingen te versterken.
Je werkt samen met onze externe partners die onze datawarehouse beheren en je draagt zorg voor een optimale samenwerking tussen interne en externe stakeholders.
Je integreert data-oplossingen in onze bedrijfsprocessen en werkt nauw samen met project- en productmanagers.
Je begeleidt en coacht collega’s om hun kennis en vaardigheden in data-analyse te vergroten.
Je ontwikkelt en implementeert een toekomstgerichte datastrategie voor onze organisatie..




Dit ben jij

Je hebt een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in de richting in data-analyse, bedrijfskunde, econometrie, of een vergelijkbare richting.
Met minimaal 3 jaar in een data-analyse rol (bij voorkeur binnen de financiële of accountancy sector) weet je hoe je data inzet om beslissingen te sturen.
Tools zoals Power BI, Tableau en programmeertalen zoals SQL of Python zijn jouw bekend.
Je weet complexe data begrijpelijk te maken en collega’s en andere stakeholders te verbinden met jouw sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je inspireert en begeleidt minder ervaren collega’s en versterkt samen het succes van het data-team
Je verbindt data, projectmanagement en productontwikkeling binnen multidisciplinaire teams.
Je bent een teamplayer die data slim inzet in processen die bijdragen aan de groei van onze organisatie.




Wat bieden wij?

Bij ons krijg je een uitdagende rol waarin je impact maakt op onze datastrategie. Je werkt in een dynamische omgeving waar innovatie en vernieuwing centraal staan. Samen met een hecht en ambitieus team krijg je de ruimte om te groeien, met flexibele werktijden en een prettige werksfeer en aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaarden die passen bij jouw inzet.




Voor jou geldt:

afhankelijk van jouw ervaring een salaris tussen de € 4750,- en € 5500,- bruto per maand bij een 40-urige werkweek
een jaarcontract met als uitgangspunt een langdurige samenwerking
een functie voor 40 uur per week




Onze secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden:

13e maand
naast 25 vakantiedagen ook 12 ATV-dagen
goede pensioenregeling
een eigen opleidingsbudget
bijdrage in je sportabonnement
goede balans werk/privé
een inspirerende flexibele werkomgeving in De Meern Utrecht (op loopafstand van twee parken), hybride werken behoort ook tot de mogelijkheden
een leuk team en bedrijfsuitjes
informele organisatie waar eigen initiatief op prijs wordt gesteld




Wie zijn wij?

Bij SRA zetten wij ons dagelijks in voor onze leden. Dit zijn mkb-accountantskantoren die lid zijn van onze vereniging. Wij faciliteren, adviseren en ondersteunen de kantoren bij alles wat ze nodig hebben. Een greep uit onze dienstverlening: vaktechnische kennis, cursussen en trainingen, strategie-advies, hr-beleid en adviesproducten voor de klanten van de kantoren.




Meer weten over onze organisatie? Neem dan ook een kijkje op onze LinkedInpagina ‘Werken bij SRA’, maar zoek gerust ook via LinkedIn Messenger contact met een van onze collega’s om te horen hoe zij ons ervaren als werkgever.




Interesse?

Spreekt deze vacature je aan? Mail je cv met motivatie naar vacature@sra.nl t.a.v. Marjolein van der Poel. Heb je nog vragen, neem dan contact op met Menno Kooreman via 030 -6566060.

  • Je analyseert grote datasets (financieel en niet- financieel) en vertaalt deze om waardevolle inzichten te creëren.
  • Je bouwt slimme datamodellen en dashboards om strategische en operationele beslissingen te versterken.
  • Je werkt samen met onze externe partners die onze datawarehouse beheren en je draagt zorg voor een optimale samenwerking tussen interne en externe stakeholders.
  • Je integreert data-oplossingen in onze bedrijfsprocessen en werkt nauw samen met project- en productmanagers.
  • Je begeleidt en coacht collega’s om hun kennis en vaardigheden in data-analyse te vergroten.
  • Je ontwikkelt en implementeert een toekomstgerichte datastrategie voor onze organisatie..


Dit ben jij

  • Je hebt een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in de richting in data-analyse, bedrijfskunde, econometrie, of een vergelijkbare richting.
  • Met minimaal 3 jaar in een data-analyse rol (bij voorkeur binnen de financiële of accountancy sector) weet je hoe je data inzet om beslissingen te sturen.
  • Tools zoals Power BI, Tableau en programmeertalen zoals SQL of Python zijn jouw bekend.
  • Je weet complexe data begrijpelijk te maken en collega’s en andere stakeholders te verbinden met jouw sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.
  • Je inspireert en begeleidt minder ervaren collega’s en versterkt samen het succes van het data-team
  • Je verbindt data, projectmanagement en productontwikkeling binnen multidisciplinaire teams.
  • Je bent een teamplayer die data slim inzet in processen die bijdragen aan de groei van onze organisatie.


Wat bieden wij?

Bij ons krijg je een uitdagende rol waarin je impact maakt op onze datastrategie. Je werkt in een dynamische omgeving waar innovatie en vernieuwing centraal staan. Samen met een hecht en ambitieus team krijg je de ruimte om te groeien, met flexibele werktijden en een prettige werksfeer en aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaarden die passen bij jouw inzet.


Voor jou geldt:

  • afhankelijk van jouw ervaring een salaris tussen de € 4750,- en € 5500,- bruto per maand bij een 40-urige werkweek
  • een jaarcontract met als uitgangspunt een langdurige samenwerking
  • een functie voor 40 uur per week

  • naast 25 vakantiedagen ook 12 ATV-dagen
  • goede pensioenregeling
  • een eigen opleidingsbudget
  • bijdrage in je sportabonnement
