Title: BI/information analyst
Description:
Brand New Day is on a journey to transform data into actionable insights that drive operational efficiency and customer happiness. With a robust cloud data platform already in place, we are looking for an experienced BI/information analyst to help us radically improve and speed up delivery of insights and reports.

Join a growing data team, where your analytical skills and getting-things-done mentality will play a pivotal role in delivering dimensional data models and data analyses.

What will you do as BI analyst in the data team?

Requirements

You will define clear data requirements, build dimensional data models and deliver insightful data analysis. On a day to day basis, you:


use dbt and SQL to build and maintain data models on our Azure Databricks platform
are/will be the go-to person for our company data dictionary for financial, risk and regulatory reporting
deliver insightful data analysis to support data-driven decision-making
work in sprints with data engineers, business analysts and a product owner in the data team
collaborate on a regular basis with business stakeholders from e.g. risk, treasury, finance and commerce


What We’re Looking For

You bring a blend of analytical and technical problem-solving skills with a solid business sense. You are:


an analytical problem solver
collaborative
thorough
curious, and an applied learner
experienced or interested in financial, risk and regulatory reporting in banking
capable of delivering data requirements, data ontologies and data insights
experienced in SQL, dbt, Azure Databricks (or similar) and Power BI
based in the Netherlands, fluent in English and speak (basic) Dutch


Why join?


We are a young and bold company that has been growing fast for 15 years.
We are cloud-native and have a modern data tech stack.
Work on impactful projects that shape decision-making across the company.
Feel free to propose and implement solutions that fit our business needs.
Take the opportunity to shape and grow your own role.
Be part of a close-knit team in a flexible, hybrid work environment.


We offer


Money
To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension and pay for your travel expenses
Room to do things your way
25 days of paid leave per year, as long as you promise to come back
Opportunity to join meet-ups
A vibrant company and 200 great colleagues with an average age of 32   
Education budget


What are you waiting for?   

Step 1: Upload your resume and motivational letter

Step 2: Interview at our office (or online) with a product owner and/or manager

Step 3: Interview at the office with senior engineers

Step 4: Be hired, be awesome

 

This Is What We Stand For  

Our motto is: extra retirement savings for everyone. And by everyone, we really mean everyone. Regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, age etc.   

    

This also applies to the people who work at Brand New Day. We believe that healthy diversity and inclusion lead to better collaboration, better service for our customers and consequently to better results. But it also leads to more personal growth and fun at work. It doesn’t matter who you are, we care about what you contribute. It’s not the number of stripes on your sleeve that determines whether one is right, but who has the best idea.   

    

Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? Please reconsider and apply even if you don’t. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a motivated Junior Data Engineer to join our client, a dynamic and fast-growing energy trading company in Amsterdam. This is a unique opportunity to develop your skills while contributing to innovative solutions in the energy trading industry.

About The Role


Spend 50-60% of your time developing and optimizing data solutions.
Dedicate 40-50% to collaborating with energy traders to understand business needs and translate them into actionable tasks.
Ideal for recent graduates or professionals with up to 2 years of experience eager to grow in energy trading.


Responsibilities


Collaborate directly with energy traders to gather and understand business requirements.
Develop and maintain high-quality data pipelines using:
Java 21, AWS (including Lambda functions)
Apache Kafka, Maven, Log4j, JUnit 5, JSoup
Implement serverless solutions using AWS infrastructure.
Utilize in-house producer and consumer utilities while adhering to established design patterns.
Ensure code quality meets industry standards.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
0-2 years of relevant experience (internships and academic projects are welcome).
Basic knowledge of Java and related tools.
Excellent communication skills in English.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.


Soft Skills


Strong interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with traders and technical teams.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and business needs.
Proactive problem-solving mindset and team-oriented approach.


Why Join Us?


Work in an exciting and fast-paced energy trading environment.
Collaborate with a supportive team using cutting-edge tools and technologies.
Opportunity for growth, including transitioning to the client’s payroll.
Based in Amsterdam, one of Europe’s most vibrant cities.


How To Apply

If you’re ready to kickstart or grow your data engineering career, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and take the first step toward an exciting journey in energy trading!

Title: BI Consultant (Healthcare)
HTML:
Het beste resultaat voor de klant in de vorm van flexibele, betrouwbare dataoplossingen, daar gaan we in Utrecht voor. Wil jij de zorg verbeteren met vooruitstrevende BI-projecten met als doel om de zorg te helpen met de mogelijkheden van data? Voor jou betekent dat: gaaf werk in de zorg, persoonlijke ontwikkeling en groei.


Wat bieden wij jou?

  • Interessante projecten binnen de gezondheidszorg (ziekenhuizen, care en GGZ);
  • Het gehele traject: van (ruwe) data tot dynamische dashboards;
  • Een omgeving waarin het hybride werken compleet omarmd wordt;
  • Technische trainingen op maat met certificaten die jouw expertise onderstrepen;
  • Persoonlijk loopbaantraject, met alle ruimte om je eigen carrière pad te bewandelen;
  • Werk zelfstandig, maar geniet ook van de voordelen van een hecht team.


Jouw functie als BI Consultant (Healthcare)

Als BI Consultant (Healthcare) vervul je een belangrijke rol bij het oplossen van complexe informatievraagstukken. Hierbij richt je je met name op datawarehousing, data-integratie en het beschikbaar stellen van de verzamelde data. De meest betrouwbare informatie wordt op een gestructureerde manier ontsloten. Ook help je de eindgebruiker aan de juiste rapportages en dashboards, bijvoorbeeld met Power BI.


Je vervult je opdrachten bij met name zorgorganisaties. Jij bent, op basis van jouw kennis van de zorg in staat om de ontvangen informatievragen te vertalen naar technische oplossingen. Interessant en leerzaam werk, waarbij je samenwerkt met deskundige en inspirerende collega’s én natuurlijk met de klant. Realiseren van hoogwaardige oplossingen voor mooie opdrachtgevers en werken aan je eigen ontwikkeling in één!


Wat vragen wij van jou?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO diploma;
  • Minstens 3 jaar ervaring als consultant op het gebied van Business Intelligence;
  • Kennis van de zorg op het gebied van kwaliteit, financiering en/of capaciteitsmanagement;
  • Kennis van bekende EPD’s / ECD’s in de zorg zoals bijvoorbeeld HiX, Epic, Nedap Ons;
  • Uitstekende kennis van dataplatforms binnen Microsoft (SQL Server, Azure Data Platform, Power BI).


Het team

Bij ilionx werken 350 BI- en Data specialisten, die dagelijks interessante projecten uitvoeren. Hiervan zijn ruim 70 collega’s met de focus op zorg. Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Carry1st is Africa's leading publisher of mobile games and digital content. Operating at the intersection of games, publishing, and fintech, we scale awesome content in frontier markets by solving hard problems. Across our publishing and Pay1st business lines, we are partnered with top global game companies like Riot Games, Activision, and Stillfront. We are backed by top investors like: a16z, Bitkraft, Google, Konvoy, Riot Games, Sony and Nas.

As a Marketing Data Analyst you will generate insights into our players and our acquisition campaigns, leading to strategic recommendations and operational optimisations that drive cost efficient acquisition of high-valued customers.

You will...


Insights & Optimisation: Utilise advanced analytics to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities, translating these into strategic recommendations and/or operational optimisation
Business Needs to Analytical Solutions: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business questions & hypotheses into structured analysis, defining key metrics to track success
Reporting: Develop, operationalise, and maintain dashboards & automated reports - to visualise key performance indicators for senior management and to aid operational decisioning for marketing teams
Experimentation: Design and evaluate A/B tests to validate hypotheses, using deep dives and segmentations to further guide the UA roadmap
Data Management: Ensure data accuracy and integrity, establishing best practices where there is no single source of truth



Requirements

What makes you a great candidate?


Strong understanding of the mobile advertising space - networks, bidding systems, & algorithms - and fluent with the key funnel metrics - CTR, CVR, CPI, ARPU, Retention, LTV
Fluent in SQL. Proficiency in Tableau and Python pluses
Strong analytical skills backed by statistical fundamentals
Strong problem solving acumen backed by the ability to tackle ambiguity
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work cross-functionally with Marketing, Product, and Data teams



Benefits

What will it be like to work at Carry1st?

Carry1st is a fast-paced and dynamic place to work. Our team is diverse and global as we operate fully-remotely across 25+ countries. At Carry1st, you will have the opportunity to...


Build awesome, industry-changing products, every day
Grow with a VC-backed startup at the intersection of gaming and fintech
Work from anywhere in the world with international teammates
Own shares in the Company - enabling you to benefit from the value you create



Some Additional Perks...


Co-working excursions: Travel to meet your colleagues in cities around the world
Awesome equipment: Get everything you need to work effectively
Remote working allowance: Put an additional $600 / year to optimise your WFH experience
Learning and development: Attend courses, conferences and training events
Social events: Participate in regular company events to relax and connect with teammates
Birthday leave: Enjoy a paid day off on your special day


We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. Join us!

Learn More About Carry1st...


Andreessen Horowitz shared why they invested in Carry1st
VentureBeat announced that Carry1st has raised $27 million to develop and publish mobile games in Africa
Remerge hosted Cordel on a podcast to discuss Carry1st and the African gaming market

At Siemens Energy, we are dedicated to nurturing innovation and forward-thinking. We are currently seeking a motivated and diligent student to join our Finance team as a Data Analyst. If you are a quick learner, well-organized, and passionate about data, we encourage you to apply.

The job is flexible and will be aligned with your studies.

Your Daily Responsibilities

You will be involved in data mapping, assisting with implementing a new data warehouse, making data analysis, and translating business needs into technical specifications for IT. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with data providers to maintain database accuracy and integrate data from various sources to offer a comprehensive view of business performance. Your tasks will include:


Conducting detailed data analysis to uncover insights and trends
Supporting the development and implementation of data-driven solutions
Assisting in the design and maintenance of data systems and databases
Ensuring data quality and integrity by performing regular audits and validations
Creating detailed and comprehensive reports for the business
Collaborating with multi-functional teams to gather and define data requirements



How You’ll Make An Impact

Improving our reporting and data analysis capabilities. This position offers you the opportunity to contribute your expertise and innovative ideas, rather than simply performing routine tasks. You will play an important role in:


Enhancing the accuracy and efficiency of our data reporting processes
Providing actionable insights that drive business decisions and strategies
Streamlining data workflows to enhance productivity and performance
Facilitating better data-driven decision-making across the organization
Bringing to bear your technical skills to solve complex data challenges



What You Bring

To be successful in this role, you should have:


Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, SAS, Power BI, and Power Apps
Knowledge of deep learning/machine learning, unstructured/structured data, and data warehousing fundamentals
Proficient skills in Microsoft Office and a passion for numbers and data
A bachelor's degree in Finance, Data Science, or Mathematics, or Master's degree or equivalent experience in Finance, Data Science, or Machine Learning
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for effective collaboration with colleagues from diverse professional backgrounds
High integrity, team spirit, and a proactive approach to collaboration



If you are ready to make a difference and grow with us, we invite you to apply and join our team at Siemens Energy.

About The Finance Team

Our Finance team provides a dynamic and exciting environment where you can grow and make a significant impact. We value collaboration and innovation, and we are committed to supporting your professional development. Our team strives for excellence and works together to achieve ambitious goals, ensuring that our data analyses are exceptionally accurate, and our processes are detailed. We believe in the power of teamwork and are determined to successfully conduct world-class solutions that compete at the highest levels.

At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With more than 98,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen, Denmark

About The Job

Do you want to work with management reporting and financial crime prevention in one? Saxo is an investments bank, with high speed, global colleagues and we are looking for a Data Analyst to work within the AML program management and reporting team.

The AML program is part of 1st Line of defense in Group Operations and located in Saxo’s headquarters in Hellerup. We are currently a team of four dedicated employees with diverse backgrounds and experience, and we are looking for new colleagues to join our program. The responsibility of the program team is to ensure progress on the Financial Crime Prevention globally across Saxo.

As our new Data Analyst, your primary focus will be to work closely with the reporting and data team to develop and implement multiple reporting solutions based on the right data. Furthermore, you will be responsible for supporting senior management and financial crime prevention leadership with data requests on different projects.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate should possess a balanced blend of business acumen and IT expertise. Saxo has a client-centric focus, which requires the candidate to comprehend data analysis and issues from a business standpoint. It is a requirement for this role to be able to collaborate with and communicate across departments and business units in the organization. The nature of the position is analyzing data stemming from financial crime prevention business units, so findings, scoping and collaboration of fixing issues will take place across the value chain.

Besides this, the candidate must be self-driven and interested in learning how the business works. Experience with data analysis itself and with other financial institutions is a plus, but the right attitude can go a long way if other elements are missing.

Your profile

You thrive in an environment with constant changes but have an eye for the details. You may have experience from the financial sector within financial crime prevention or are eager to expand your qualification in this area.

The Ideal Candidate For The Job


Understanding of how data is used within business processes and its impact on desired business process outcomes.
Experience with data analysis of big data sets using SQL, Power BI, and Excel.
Experience with Databricks would be an advantage.
Solid project management skills to guide point-in-time and ongoing targeted data quality projects. 
Comprehensive understanding of the importance and impact of data (or bad data) on the ability of the business to meet its own objectives. 
Facilitation and conflict resolution skills to assist in resolving the different points of view and requirements that invariably collide during cross-team and cross-organization efforts.
Have experience in presenting and reporting to senior management
Have good communications skills both verbally and in writing.
Masters English on a professional level


We conduct interviews on a continuous basis, so send your application sooner rather than later.

Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis.

We get curious people invested in the world

When you work at Saxo, you become a Saxonian and part of a purpose-driven organisation, where good ideas are always taken seriously, and where you can make a true impact. We are invested in your development, and you can expect a robust career from day one when you join Saxo – no matter which role you take on.

You will join 2,500 other ambitious colleagues across 15 countries and become part of an international organisation. Working in Saxo, you will get to meet colleagues from many different cultures and backgrounds, and you should know that we value diversity and inclusion and see it as a genuine source of strength to drive growth, foster innovation and position us for long-term success.

We encourage an open feedback culture and supportive team environments enabling employees to grow and fulfil their career aspirations.

When you bring passion, curiosity, drive and team spirit, your learning journey will be dynamic and your career opportunities in Saxo will be immense.

At Saxo we don’t just offer a job – we offer an opportunity to invest in your future!

Description:
Our client is a global leader in premium lifestyle products, specializing in apparel, accessories, home, fragrances, and hospitality. The Global Customer Insights & Experience (CIX) team is seeking a motivated data analyst to support the integration and analysis of large customer data sets, focusing on understanding customer behaviour and interactions with global brands and labels.

Responsibilities:




Utilising the data extracted from data science teams and drawing out customer insights relating to different labels and brands.
Design and build data extracts, manipulations, and summarisations to address customer data questions.
Apply the best technical methodologies and approaches for analysing large data sets on SQL and Tableau.
Collaborate with various teams to deliver clear, actionable insights for global brands and labels.

Requirements:




2-3 years of data analyst experience, ideally from a consulting background.
Experience with large transactional and behavioural data sources.
Proficiency in SQL, Tableau, Dataiku, and Microsoft Office.
Strong communication skills with the ability to turn complex data into actionable insights.

Details:




Start date: ASAP
Location: Hybrid, 2 days per week in the London office
Salary: circa. £55k FTC
Duration: 12 months

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Convex occupies a unique position in the insurance industry, combining unrivalled experience, reputation and a legacy free balance sheet. We offer international specialty insurance and reinsurance, along with digital risk management solutions, through our operations in Bermuda, London, Europe and the US.







We are currently looking to hire 2025 graduates for the the Portfolio Optimisation team. The Portfolio Optimisation (PO) function creates competitive advantage through industry leading decision making enabled by comprehensive data and cross functional analytics. The MI & Insights team is looking to hire a Graduate Data & Insights Analyst to join the team in September 2025 to help utilize data & analytics to inform and influence better underwriting decisions, and which complements and supports Convex’s strategic vision.







Key Responsibilities

Aggregation, analysis & interpretation of the data captured from across the business (e.g., from Underwriters across Insurance & Reinsurance)
Support the business planning process by conducting analyses to influence decision-making within underwriting management and collating & validating key assumptions
Conduct market analysis to spot trends and themes occurring in the market as well as peer benchmarking
Build tools & create dashboards to replay back the information in a technical yet simple fashion to be used in decision making
Maintenance of the tools & dashboards, including continuous enhancements
Support and contribute to various strategic projects across Convex and within PO
Practice excellent interpersonal skills to liaise with business functions
Provide /coordinate additional administrative support as business development and maturity requires
Liaise with key stakeholders across the business




Skills Knowledge and Expertise

Strong analytical & numerical capabilities
Strong data skills (logic and structure)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Possesses a continuous improvement mindset
Proven ability to solve problems and identify practical solutions

Title: Data Analyst – up to £90k – Investment Management firm
Description:
Are you interested in building dashboards to allow an Investment Manager to interpret and analyse their ESG data?




You will be working directly with the senior stakeholders in the firm to understand what insights they are looking to gain, then build reports and dashboards using SQL and PowerBI.




Alongside this, you’ll spend the other half of your time analysing the ESG data and markets, looking for ways you can influence and impact the firm’s performance.




This is a relatively junior role, so while you may have some experience with PowerBI, Tableau or SSRS, this is an opportunity to develop those skills further and progress into a Senior position over the next few years.




The Investment Manager has roughly $110 billion AUM and has been identified as one of the fastest growing globally over the last year – which will provide even more opportunities for progression within the role.




No up-to-date CV required.
